poem:
Title: Margarine Memories

Margarine maiden in the apron of youth, 
Baking blocks of yesteryear seeped in truth.
Meeting the 60s in Truro, under ration's reign, 
Scones born of sacrifice, kneaded in the grain.
Fingers stained by memories, the past on her palate,
Not for posh bakers' butter, her thrifty sonnet.
Woken not by wokery, but recall's sweet decree,
Home's recipe, bound always, in vegetable decree.
